conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! I can help you minimize food waste.

• Plan your meals for the week before grocery shopping. This prevents impulse buys that often go to waste.

• Store food properly: Store vegetables in the refrigerator crisper drawer and keep bread in a cool, dry place. This extends shelf life.

• Cook only what you need: Prepare smaller portions to avoid leftovers that might spoil.

• Use leftovers creatively: Turn leftover chicken curry into delicious chicken wraps (approx. 50 BDT).

Reducing food waste lowers greenhouse gas emissions from landfills.

Next step: Start by planning your meals for the upcoming week.

Hello! I can suggest some vegetables that are great for reducing food waste.

• Try buying vegetables that last longer, like potatoes (20 BDT/kg) and onions (30 BDT/kg).

• Opt for seasonal vegetables, as they are fresher and more affordable. For example, right now, you can find plenty of inexpensive gourds like Lau (30 BDT each).

• Consider buying frozen vegetables (100 BDT/pack). They won't spoil quickly, and you can use only what you need.

Next step: Head to your local bazaar and look for seasonal vegetables that are on sale!
